newsitem.title: USA: C-Cube rises on link to Zenith - analyst.
newsitem.headline: C-Cube rises on link to Zenith - analyst.

text.p: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug 23 (Reuter) Shares of C-Cube Microsystems Inc rose 4-3/8 to 34-3/4 on the possibility that the maker of semiconductor-based encoders could get some of Zenith Electronics Corp's $1 billion contract for supplying ditigal TV set-top boxes to the Americast consortium, analysts said.

"The activity in the stock today and yesterday is related to the announcement by Zenith, tied back to DiviCom which C-Cube will close (acquire) on next week," said Alex Brown & Sons analyst Greg Mischou. "My understanding is DiviCom has a design win from Zenith," he said.
C-Cube has had an agreement to acquire DiviCom, a Milpitas, Calif.-based maker of technology used in set-top boxes, in a deal scheduled to close Aug. 28.
The possibility of C-Cube ending up supplying Zenith was reported in the San Francisco Chronicle on Friday.
C-Cube officials did not immediately return phone calls.

Mischou said that while such a supply contract would surely be positive, "There are a lot of factors that have to come together before this can be put in the numbers," or estimates of how a Zenith contract would affect C-Cube's revenues or earnings. "First it is a 1997 event," he said.
Analyst Elias Moosa of Robertson, Stephens & Co said the possibility that C-Cube will wind up getting Zenith's business "at this time is still speculation."

But he added that the Americast-Zenith deal suggests that "C-Cube could be a prime beneficiary of a wider opportunity," from Americast and from other companies in the current move to deploy digital cable TV systems and set top box technology. "Americast serves 68 million customers, they are not going to stop at 3 million," Moosa said. The deal between Zenith and Americast calls for Zenith to supply at least 3 million set top boxes.
